sen.j: 寺院に依存しない一所不住の諸国遊行や、入寂に際して「一代聖教皆尽きて南無阿弥陀仏に成り果てぬ」と自らの著作を燃やしたという伝記から、その高潔さに惹かれる現代人は多い。
sen.e: Due to his pilgrimages in various provinces without staying one place and without dependency to temples, and also due to his biography that he burned his own literary work when he died, saying 'One generation of shogyo (Buddhist sutra) are all exhausted and become Namu Amidabutsu (a single, sincere call upon the name of Amida)', there are many people nowadays that are fascinated by his high-mindedness.

Many modern people are fascinated by his high-mindedness symbolized by his pilgrimages to various provinces without staying in one place to depend on a temple, and his last moments, according to his biography, in which he burned his own writings, saying, 'this is the last moment for the Buddhist sutra which was learned in a single lifetime and there is nothing to remain but the voice of chanting Namu Amidabutsu (a single, sincere call upon the name of Amida).'
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人語録』（岩波文庫）の解説をもとに訳しなおしました。
sen.e: Many modern people are fascinated by his high-mindedness symbolized by his pilgrimages to various provinces without staying in one place to depend on a temple, and his last moments, according to his biography, in which he burned his own writings, saying, 'this is the last moment for the Buddhist sutra which was learned in a single lifetime and there is nothing to remain but the voice of chanting Namu Amidabutsu (a single, sincere call upon the name of Amida).'

sen.j: 和歌や和讃によるわかりやすい教化や信不信・浄不浄を問わない念仏勧進は、仏教を庶民のものとする大いなる契機となった。
sen.e: His easy-to-understand edification through waka (traditional Japanese poems of thirty-one syllables) and wasan (Buddhist verses) and nenbutsu kanjin to all people regardless of his/her belief or disbelief, cleanliness or uncleanliness were a big opportunity for Buddhism to become religion of the common people.

sen.j: いわゆる鎌倉新仏教の祖師の中で、唯一比叡山で修学した経験のない人物である。

Hiei (The description in "Ippenjonin Nenpuryaku" (brief chronicle of Ippen shonin) is considered to be made later. He has climbed 'Nishi no Eizan,' Shosha-zan Mountain.), and it is pointed out that he was not an official monk but belonged to the line of private religious people from shidoso (priests having entered Buddhist priesthood without permission) to hijiri (a high-ranking priest).

sen.j: （『一遍上人年譜略』の記述は後世のものと考えられる。）

sen.j: 有名な法語、和歌

Famous Buddhist sermons and waka

sen.j: 旅ころも 木の根 かやの根いづくにか 身の捨られぬ処あるべき（時宗宗歌となっている）
sen.e: Tabi koromo/Ki no ne kaya no ne/Izukunika/Mi no suterarenu/Tokoro arubeki (The song of Jishu sect)
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず
sen.e: My life is traveling and nowhere is impossible to bury my body under a tree or grass (The song of Jishu sect).

sen.e: My life is traveling and nowhere is impossible to bury my body under a tree or grass (The song of Jishu sect).

sen.j: 身を観ずれば水の泡 消ぬる後は人もなし 命を思へば月の影 出で入る息にぞ留まらぬ
sen.e: Miwo kanzureba mizuno awa/Kienuru atoha hitomo nashi/Inochi wo omoeba tsukino kage/Ideiru ikinizo todomararu
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず
sen.e: Human body looks like a fragile bubble floating on water and no one can remain after the shape disappear, and life is just like the light of the moon which rises and sets, because it does not stay even for a short time between breathing in and out.
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳を一部参考に訳出しました。
sen.e: Human body looks like a fragile bubble floating on water and no one can remain after the shape disappear, and life is just like the light of the moon which rises and sets, because it does not stay even for a short time between breathing in and out.

sen.j: 生ずるは独り、死するも独り、共に住するといえど独り、さすれば、共にはつるなき故なり
sen.e: We are born alone, die alone, and although we live together, we are still alone, so 共にはつるなき故なり.
sen.cmt: 「共にはつるなき故なり」、解釈困難なため訳出できず
sen.e: We are born alone, die alone, and we are still alone even if we live together, that is the reason why people do not die together.
sen.cmt: 「共にはつるなき故なり」資料が見つかりませんでしたが、このように訳しました。
sen.e: We are born alone, die alone, and we are still alone even if we live together, that is the reason why people do not die together.

sen.j: 夫れ、念佛の行者用心のこと、示すべき由承り候。
sen.e: So, nenbutsu practitioners should be careful, 示すべき由承り候.
sen.cmt: 「示すべき由承り候。」解釈困難なため訳出できず
sen.e: I received your request for teaching what nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) devotees should bear in mind.
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳を一部参考に訳し直しました。
sen.e: I received your request for teaching what nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) devotees should bear in mind.

sen.j: 南無阿彌陀佛と申す外さらに用心もなく、此外に又示すべき安心もなし。
sen.e: There is no other precautions than saying Namuamidabutsu, and there is no other peace to show.
There is nothing to bear in mind other than saying Namu Amidabutsu, and there is no other faith to show.
sen.cmt: no other precautions than→nothing to bear in mind other than としました。ファイル内統一のため、Namuamidabutsu→Namu Amidabutsu としました。原文の「安心」は「あんしん」でなく「あんじん」と思われますので、peace→faith としました。
sen.e: There is nothing to bear in mind other than saying Namu Amidabutsu, and there is no other faith to show.

sen.j: 諸々の智者達の樣々に立てをかるる法要どもの侍るも、皆誘惑に對したる假初の要文なり。
sen.e: Although there are Buddhist memorial services that are practiced by various wise men, they are all temporary summaries against allurement.
Although there are various Buddhist teachings developed by various learned priests, they are all temporary teachings against allurement.
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳を一部参考に訳し直しました。原文には「誘惑」とあり、指示書に従い原文のまま訳出してありますが、『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）、『一遍上人語録』（岩波文庫）ではともに「諸惑」となっており、こちらが正しいと思われます。
sen.e: Although there are various Buddhist teachings developed by various learned priests, they are all temporary teachings against allurement.

sen.j: されば念佛の行者は、かやうの事をも打ち捨てて念佛すべし。
sen.e: Then, nenbutsu practitioners should practice nenbutsu throwing out such things.
So, nenbutsu devotees should practice nenbutsu throwing out such things.
sen.cmt: Then→So としました。practitioners→devotees としました。
sen.e: So, nenbutsu devotees should practice nenbutsu throwing out such things.

sen.j: むかし、空也上人へ、ある人、念佛はいかが申すべきやと問ひければ、「捨ててこそ」とばかりにて、なにとも仰せられずと、西行法師の「撰集抄」に載せられたり。
sen.e: According to Senjusho (a compiled Buddhist tales of 13th century) by Saigyo Hoshi (Buddhist priest Saigyo), a long time ago, someone asked the virtuous Buddhist priest Kuya how nenbutsu should be practiced, and he said nothing but 'By throwing out.'

According to 'Senjusho' (a compiled Buddhist tales of 13th century) by Saigyo Hoshi (Buddhist priest Saigyo), a long time ago, someone asked the virtuous Buddhist priest Kuya how nenbutsu should be practiced, and he said nothing but 'By throwing out.'

According to 'Senjusho' (a compiled Buddhist tales of 13th century) by Saigyo Hoshi (Buddhist priest Saigyo), a long time ago, someone asked the virtuous Buddhist priest Kuya how nenbutsu should be practiced, and he said nothing but 'By throwing out.'

sen.j: 是れ誠に金言なり。
sen.e: This is really pearls of wisdom.
This is really a golden saying.
This is truly a pearl of wisdom.
sen.cmt: 元に戻してa pearl of wisdomtと変更しました。

sen.j: 念佛の行者は智慧をも愚癡をも捨て、善惡の境界をも捨て、貴賤高下の道理をも捨て、地獄をおそるる心をも捨て、極樂を願ふ心をも捨て、又諸宗の悟をも捨て、一切の事を捨てて申す念佛こそ、彌陀超世の本願に尤もかなひ候へ。
sen.e: Nenbutsu practitioners should throw out wisdom and 愚癡, throw out differentiation of good and evil, throw out reason of rich and poor, high and low, throw out fear for Hell, throw out hope for the Buddhist paradise, and throw out enlightenment of various sects, and when you practice nenbutsu throwing out everything, the all-surpassing vows of Amida shall be fulfilled.

Nenbutsu devotees should throw out wisdom and doubts, throw out the differentiation between good and evil, throw out the distinction between high and low social standing, throw out fear for Hell, throw out hope for the Buddhist paradise, and throw out enlightenment of various sects, and when you practice nenbutsu throwing out everything, it comes closest to the transcendent, Original Vow of Amida.
sen.cmt: practitioners→devotees としました。愚癡→doubts としました。（「愚痴」に同じ。理非の区別のつかないおろかさ（広辞苑）。『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳では「迷い」と訳されています）the を追加、of→between としました。reason of rich and poor, high and low→the distinction between high and low social standing としました。「彌陀超世の本願に尤もかなひ候へ」を訳しなおしました。
sen.e: Nenbutsu devotees should throw out wisdom and doubts, throw out the differentiation between good and evil, throw out the distinction between high and low social standing, throw out fear for Hell, throw out hope for the Buddhist paradise, and throw out enlightenment of various sects, and when you practice nenbutsu throwing out everything, it comes closest to the transcendent, Original Vow of Amida.

sen.j: かやうに打ちあげ打ちあげ唱ふれば、佛もなく我もなく、まして此内に兎角の道理もなし。
sen.e: When you practice nenbutsu 打ちあげ打ちあげ, there is no Buddha or self, nor any reason in it.
sen.cmt: 「打ちあげ打ちあげ」解釈困難なため訳出できず。
sen.e: When you practice nenbutsu at the top of your voice, there is no Buddha or self, nor any reason in it.
sen.cmt: 打ちあげ打ちあげ→at the top of your voice としました。（『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳では「声をはり上げて」と訳されています）
sen.e: When you practice nenbutsu at the top of your voice, there is no Buddha or self, nor any reason in it.

sen.j: 善惡の境界、皆淨土なり。
sen.e: The border of good and evil is all in the pure land.
The secular world of good and evil will be absorbed into nenbutsu to become the pure land itself.
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳を参考に訳し直しました。（原文の「境界」は「きょうかい」でなく「きょうがい」と思われます）
sen.e: The secular world of good and evil will be absorbed into nenbutsu to become the pure land itself.

sen.j: 外に求むべからず。
sen.e: Do not seek it in other places.
Do not seek the pure land in something else.
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳を参考に訳し直しました。
sen.e: Do not seek the pure land in something else.

sen.j: 厭ふべからず。
sen.e: Do not avoid.
Do not hate the secular world.
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳を参考に訳し直しました。
sen.e: Do not hate the secular world.

sen.j: よろづ生きとし生けるもの、山河草木、吹く風、立つ浪の音までも、念佛ならずといふことなし。
sen.e: Every living thing, mountains, rivers, plants, blowing wind, and even the sound of ｗaves are nothing but nenbutsu.
Every living thing, mountains, rivers, plants, blowing wind, and even the sound of ｗave can be nenbutsu.
sen.cmt: waves→wave としました。are nothing but nenbutsu→can be nenbutsu としました。
sen.e: Every living thing, mountains, rivers, plants, blowing wind, and even the sound of ｗave can be nenbutsu.

sen.j: 人ばかり超世の願に預るにあらず。
sen.e: Its not only men who have the world transcending vows.
It is not only human beings who can obtain salvation by the transcendent vow.
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳を参考に訳し直しました。
sen.e: It is not only human beings who can obtain salvation by the transcendent vow.

sen.j: またかくの如く愚老が申す事も意得にくく候はば、意得にくきにまかせて、愚老が申す事をも打ち捨て、何ともかともあてがひはからずして、本願に任せて念佛し給ふべし。
sen.e: If it is hard to understand what such a foolish old man says, leave it as it is hard to understand, throw out what this foolish old man says, 何ともかともあてがひはからずして, leave everything to the primal vow and just practice nenbutsu.
sen.cmt: 「何ともかともあてがひはからずして」解釈困難なため訳出できず。
sen.e: If it is hard to understand what this foolish old man says, leave it as it is hard to understand, throw out what this foolish old man says, never try to stretch the meaning to make sense, and leave everything to the Original Vow and just practice nenbutsu.
sen.cmt: such a→this としました。何ともかともあてがひはからずして→never try to stretch the meaning to make sense としました。（『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳で、「あてがひはからずして」は「あてはめて考えたりしないで」と訳されています）and を追加しました。the primal vow→the Original Vow としました。
sen.e: If it is hard to understand what this foolish old man says, leave it as it is hard to understand, throw out what this foolish old man says, never try to stretch the meaning to make sense, and leave everything to the Original Vow and just practice nenbutsu.

sen.j: 念佛は安心して申すも、安心せずして申すも、他力超世の本願にたがふ事なし。
sen.e: If you practice nenbutsu with ease or without ease, 他力超世の本願にたがふ事なし.
sen.cmt: 「他力超世の本願にたがふ事なし」解釈困難なため訳出できず。
sen.e: If you practice nenbutsu with or without faith, it never goes against the transcendent, Original Vow of Other-Power.
sen.cmt: 原文の「安心」は「あんしん」でなく「あんじん」と思われますので、with ease or without ease→with or without faith としました。
sen.e: If you practice nenbutsu with or without faith, it never goes against the transcendent, Original Vow of Other-Power.

sen.j: 彌陀の本願には缺けたる事もなく、餘れる事もなし。
sen.e: There is nothing missing or excess in the primal vow of Amida.
There is no deficiency or excess in the Original Vow of Amida.
sen.cmt: nothing missing→no deficiency としました。the primal vow→the Original Vow としました。
sen.e: There is no deficiency or excess in the Original Vow of Amida.

sen.j: 此外にさのみ何事をか用心して申すべき。
sen.e: 此外にさのみ何事をか用心して申すべき。

sen.e: What else should I tell you to bear in mind?
sen.cmt: 『一遍上人全集』（春秋社）現代語訳を参考に訳出しました。
sen.e: What else should I tell you to bear in mind?

sen.j: ただ愚なる者の心に立ちかへりて念佛し給ふべし。
sen.e: Just go back to the heart of a foolish man and practice nenbutsu.
Just go back to the heart of a foolish man and practice nenbutsu.
Just go back to the heart of a foolish man and practice nenbutsu.

sen.e: Namuamidabutsu.
Namu Amidabutsu.
sen.cmt: ファイル内統一のため、Namu Amidabutsu としました。
sen.e: Namu Amidabutsu.

sen.e: The disciples include Jokai, who left "The Ippen hijiri-e" (Painting of St. Ippen) and who is said to be Ippen's younger paternal half-brother, and Taa (, Shinkyo) who is two-years older.

sen.e: The disciples included Jokai, who left "The Ippen hijiri-e" (Painting of St. Ippen) and is said to be Ippen's younger paternal half-brother, and Ta (hoi: Shinkyo) who was two-years older than Ippen.

Current Jishu sect holds Ippen as the founder, but the sect was officially formed by the policy of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

Ippen did not have the intent to found a sect, and it would not be allowed to do so in the framework of eight sects.
Ippen did not have the intent to found a sect, and it would not be allowed to do so in the framework of eight sects.

sen.e: In the early-modern times, Buddhist laws of Shunjo IKKO and Kokua, which are considered to have been originally in a different line, were absorbed, and there was time when temples that worship Kuya were considered to belong to Jishu sect.

In the early-modern times, Buddhist laws of Shunjo IKKO and Kokua, which are considered to have been originally in a different line, were absorbed, and there was time when temples that worship Kuya were considered to belong to Jishu sect.

From the institutional standpoint, it could be said that the real founder of Jishu sect was Ta Shinkyo (the second Traveling Saint).
